ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
ygData.msgSnippet: Yea. I m getting this big delay as to when I receive my posts. I ve updated my filters, so I should be more up to date. Simple misunderstanding about the
ygData.messageBody:
Yea. I'm getting this big delay as to when I receive my posts. I've updated
my filters, so I should be more up to date.

Simple misunderstanding about the enchanter/bard thing. No worries! :-)

---Windleaf

At 01:41 PM 1/26/01 -0800, Mike.Roach@... wrote:
>Some people are responding to your initial post on this before they are
>reading your later clarification about your class type (i.e., other than
>chanter) ;-)
>
>Don't sweat it Kaelrei, feel the love...
>
>-Faras
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Amy Pratt [mailto:pratts001@...]
>Sent: Friday, January 26, 2001 3:40 PM
>To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Soloing bards
>
>
>Sheesh. I'm not asking those bards to do the mezzing when I'm an enchanter.
>I'm asking them to do it when I'm a druid and there isn't room to root/park
>or when I'm the warrior. And they're simply unable to do it, which is a
>shame because I know they can do it. I've done it with my bard time and
>time again, and I see posts here all the time that you've done it, too.
>
>Kaelrei
>
>
> > my thoughts exactly, we're the jack of all trades, not master of that one.
> > Its usually not nice for the student to take control of the class from the
> > teacher.
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Gordon Hughes [mailto:ghughes@...]
> > Sent: January 26, 2001 4:41 PM
> > To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
> >
> >
> > *ouch!*
> >
> > I wasn't going to go there, but the internet being what it is, you can
> > always count on someone else. ;)
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> > Sent: Friday, January 26, 2001 4:15 PM
> > To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
> >
> >
> > They probably look at you funny since you are an enchanter asking a bard
>to
> > keep two targets mezzed. That would be your responsibility since you are
> > better at it. If I group with an enchanter and they ask me to mez
>targets,
> > then I'm gonna assume they are the one clueless about their class, not me.
> > I will however likely have songs memmed to bail them out in the event they
> > get in trouble.
> >
> > Now if there is no enchanter in the group and the bard can't perform basic
> > crowd control because he doesn't know how, then you have a case.
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Amy Pratt [mailto:pratts001@...]
> > Sent: Friday, January 26, 2001 10:25 AM
> > To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] Soloing bards
> >
> > Ask them to keep 2 targets mezzed and they look at you funny. In short,
>the
> > bards I'm grouping with seem so clueless about their class that they're
> > actually detrimental to the group.
> >
> >
